perturbation.original_text: The Company and the Bank will use their best efforts to cause any post-effective amendment to the Registration Statement to be declared effective by the Commission and any post-effective amendment to the Form AC or the Holding Company Application to be approved by the OTS and will immediately upon receipt of any information concerning the events listed below notify the Agent: (i) when the Registration Statement, as amended, has become effective; (ii) when the Form AC or the Holding Company Application, as amended, has been approved by the OTS; (iii) of any comments from the Commission, the OTS or any other governmental entity with respect to the Conversion contemplated by this Agreement; (iv) of the request by the Commission, the OTS or any other governmental entity for any amendment or supplement to the Registration Statement, the Form AC, Holding Company Application or for additional information; (v) of the issuance by the Commission, the OTS or any other governmental entity of any order or other action suspending the Conversion or the use of the Registration Statement or the Prospectus or any other filing of the Company or the Bank under the Conversion Regulations, or other applicable law, or the threat of any such action; (vi) of the issuance by the Commission, the OTS or any authority of any stop order suspending the effectiveness of the Registration Statement or of the initiation or threat of initiation or threat of any proceedings for that purpose; or (vii) of the occurrence of any event mentioned in paragraph (h) below. The Company and the Bank will make every reasonable effort (i) to prevent the issuance by the Commission, the OTS or any other state
perturbation.changed_text: The Company and the Bank will aim to cause any post-effective amendment to the Registration Statement to potentially be declared effective by the Commission and any post-effective amendment to the Form AC or the Holding Company Application to perhaps be approved by the OTS and may notify the Agent upon receipt of information concerning certain events: (i) if the Registration Statement, as amended, becomes effective; (ii) if the Form AC or the Holding Company Application, as amended, is approved by the OTS; (iii) regarding possible comments from the Commission, the OTS or any other governmental entity with respect to the Conversion contemplated by this Agreement; (iv) regarding a possible request by the Commission, the OTS or any other governmental entity for an amendment or supplement to the Registration Statement, the Form AC, Holding Company Application or for additional information; (v) regarding the possibility of the issuance by the Commission, the OTS or any other governmental entity of an order or other action suspending the Conversion or the use of the Registration Statement or the Prospectus or any other filing of the Company or the Bank under the Conversion Regulations, or applicable law, or a possible threat of action; (vi) regarding the possible issuance by the Commission, the OTS or any authority of any stop order suspending the effectiveness of the Registration Statement or of the possible initiation or threat of initiation of proceedings for that purpose; or (vii) regarding any events mentioned in paragraph (h) below. The Company and the Bank will try to prevent the issuance by the Commission, the OTS or any other state
perturbation.explanation: The original text imposes a clear obligation on the Company and Bank to use their best efforts to ensure regulatory compliance and to immediately notify the Agent of any relevant information. By changing 'will use their best efforts' to 'will aim to cause', 'will immediately notify' to 'may notify', and adding qualifiers such as 'potentially', 'perhaps', and 'possible,' the obligation becomes ambiguous and discretionary. This weakens the commitment to regulatory compliance and transparency.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Securities Act of 1933 and Securities Exchange Act of 1934

perturbation.original_text: The Company and the Bank will comply with any and all material terms, conditions, requirements and provisions with respect to the Offering imposed by the Commission, the OTS or the Conversion Regulations, and by the 1933 Act, the 1933 Act Regulations, the 1934 Act and the 1934 Act Regulations to be complied with prior to or subsequent to the Closing Date and when the Prospectus is required to be delivered, and during such time period the Company and the Bank will comply, at their own expense, with all material requirements imposed upon them by the Commission, the OTS or the Conversion Regulations, and by the 1933 Act, the 1933 Act Regulations, the 1934 Act and the 1934 Act Regulations, including, without limitation, Rule 10b-5 under the 1934 Act, in each case as from time to time in force, so far as necessary to permit the continuance of sales or dealing in the Common Shares during such period in accordance with the provisions hereof and the Prospectus. The Company will comply with all undertakings contained in the Registration Statement.
perturbation.changed_text: The Company and the Bank will generally aim to comply with certain material terms, conditions, requirements and provisions with respect to the Offering that the Commission, the OTS, or the Conversion Regulations impose, as well as some provisions of the 1933 Act, the 1933 Act Regulations, the 1934 Act and the 1934 Act Regulations, as deemed appropriate. They will attempt to comply, at their own expense, with the applicable requirements imposed upon them by the Commission, the OTS, or the Conversion Regulations, and under the 1933 Act, the 1933 Act Regulations, the 1934 Act, and the 1934 Act Regulations, in accordance with Rule 10b-5 under the 1934 Act, as necessary to permit continued sales or dealing in the Common Shares during such period, as deemed necessary. The Company will make efforts to adhere to undertakings contained in the Registration Statement.
perturbation.explanation: The original text mandates compliance with all material terms imposed by regulatory bodies and securities laws. Modifying 'will comply' to 'will generally aim to comply' and 'will attempt to comply,' and inserting subjective phrases like 'as deemed appropriate' and 'as necessary' introduces ambiguity. This makes compliance discretionary rather than mandatory, potentially leading to non-compliance with securities regulations.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Securities Act of 1933, Securities Exchange Act of 1934, Rule 10b-5

perturbation.original_text: The Company and the Bank will take such actions in cooperating with the Agent and furnish to whomever the Agent may direct such information as may be required to qualify or register the Shares for offering and sale by it or to exempt such Shares from registration, or to exempt the Company as a broker-dealer and its officers, directors and employees as broker-dealers or agents under the applicable securities or blue sky laws of such jurisdictions in which the Shares are required under the Conversion Regulations to be sold or as the Agent and the Company may reasonably agree upon; provided, however, that the Company shall not be obligated to file any general consent to service of
perturbation.changed_text: The Company and the Bank will consider cooperating with the Agent and may furnish to the Agentâ€™s designee some information as may be considered necessary to qualify or register the Shares for offering and sale, or to exempt the shares from registration, or to possibly exempt the Company as a broker-dealer. This may be done under the applicable securities or blue sky laws of such jurisdictions in which the Shares are, at their discretion, to be sold. The Agent and the Company may reasonably agree upon this action; provided, however, that the Company is not obligated to file consent to service of
perturbation.explanation: The original text stipulates a clear obligation for the Company and the Bank to take actions to cooperate with the Agent in registering or exempting the Shares under securities laws. Replacing 'will take such actions in cooperating' with 'will consider cooperating' and 'may furnish some information' transforms the mandatory cooperation into a discretionary one. Including 'at their discretion, to be sold' makes the obligation to comply with securities laws dependent on whether the Company chooses to sell the shares in a particular jurisdiction, which contradicts the mandatory nature of securities law compliance.
